project.name: Orion Edge Gateway
project.scope: API gateway, rate limiting, auth integration

sections.title: Project Overview & Objectives
sections.goal: Elicit a clear understanding of the Orion Edge Gateway build objectives, scope boundaries, and alignment with company mission and values.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the primary objectives of the Orion Edge Gateway project?
Which specific business needs or regulatory requirements are driving this build phase?
How does the project align with our values like 'Safety First' and 'Evidence over Hype'?

sections.title: Scope Control & Stakeholder Management
sections.goal: Understand how scope is defined, controlled, and communicated with multiple stakeholders.
sample_questions: What are the explicit in-scope and out-of-scope items for this phase?
How are scope changes evaluated and approved?
Which stakeholder groups are most critical, and how do you manage conflicting priorities?

sections.title: SLA and SLO Alignment
sections.goal: Assess how project deliverables are planned to meet SLA-ORI-02 and related SLOs.
sample_questions: What strategies are in place to ensure p95 latency stays below 120ms?
How do you monitor and report against SLA-ORI-02 during build and post-deployment?
What is the escalation path if performance testing reveals SLA breach risk?

sections.title: Integration with Auth and Security Policies
sections.goal: Explore integration approach with Aegis IAM and compliance with POL-SEC-001.
sample_questions: How is mTLS or other secure handshake implemented in the gateway?
Can you describe the challenges integrating with Aegis IAM's JIT access model?
What measures are taken to ensure least privilege is enforced across API endpoints?

sections.title: Risk Management & Mitigation
sections.goal: Identify potential risks, dependencies, and mitigation strategies.
sample_questions: What are the top three technical or delivery risks you foresee?
How are dependencies on other projects like Nimbus Observability or Poseidon Networking tracked?
Can you share an example of a risk that was mitigated early due to stakeholder input?

sections.title: Runbook and Incident Preparedness
sections.goal: Evaluate readiness through operational artifacts like RB-GW-011 and related runbooks.
sample_questions: How is the RB-GW-011 Rolling Deployments (Blue/Green) runbook incorporated into the release plan?
What is the rollback strategy if a deployment introduces a regression?
How do you ensure the team is trained on incident response before go-live?

sections.title: Decision Trade-offs & Final Readiness
sections.goal: Discuss critical decisions made, trade-offs accepted, and readiness for transition to operate phase.
sample_questions: What trade-offs were made between delivery speed and security hardening?
Were there any performance optimizations deferred to a later phase, and why?
From your perspective, is the project ready to meet its SLAs on day one of production?
